bio: Julia Michaels is a classically trained chef with a love for using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients in her recipes. She has worked in some of the world's most prestigious kitchens and has won numerous awards for her innovative dishes.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 375째F. In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Rub the mixture all over the chicken. Stuff the chicken with the lemon slices and onion slices. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour and 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165째F. Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.

In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the flour and stir to combine. Slowly whisk in the seafood stock, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Add the lobster meat, heavy cream, paprika, salt, and pepper. Bring the soup to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the soup has thickened and the flavors have melded. Serve hot with crusty bread.

Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, garlic, salt, and pepper. Brush the eggplant slices with the dressing and grill for 3-4 minutes per side, or until tender and charred. Arrange the grilled eggplant slices on a bed of mixed salad greens. Top with crumbled feta cheese and chopped parsley. Drizzle with any remaining dressing.

bio: Samantha Lee is a master chef who specializes in creating fusion dishes that combine flavors from all over the world. She is passionate about experimenting with new ingredients and techniques to create dishes that are both delicious and visually stunning.

recipes.cooking_method: In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, and vegetable oil. Add the sliced flank steak and toss to coat. Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Cook the steak for 3-4 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through. Warm the tortillas in the microwave or on a griddle. To assemble the tacos, fill each tortilla with some of the cooked steak, chopped kimchi, cilantro, and jalapeno slices.

Preheat the broiler. In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, vegetable oil, ginger, and garlic. Arrange the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with foil. Brush the miso glaze over the salmon. Broil for 6-8 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the glaze is browned and bubbly. Serve hot with steamed rice and vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 375째F. In a large bowl, toss the eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, and red bell peppers with the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Arrange the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for 25-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned. In a separate bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, 1 cup of the shredded mozzarella cheese, and 1/2 cup of the grated Parmesan cheese. Cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions. Spread a thin layer of

bio: John Smith is a classically trained chef with over 20 years of experience in fine dining. He has worked in some of the top restaurants in the world, including The French Laundry and El Bulli. John is known for his innovative and modern approach to traditional dishes, and his attention to detail is unparalleled.

recipes.cooking_method: Heat a large skillet over high heat. Pat the scallops dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Add the olive oil to the skillet and swirl to coat. Add the scallops to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. In a separate bowl, combine the grapefruit segments, orange segments, avocado, red onion, cilantro, and lime juice. Toss to combine. Serve the seared scallops with the citrus salad on the side.

recipes.recipe_name: Lobster Ravioli with Tomato Cream Sauce
ingredients: 1 lb. lobster meat, cooked and chopped
recipes.cooking_method: In a large bowl, combine the lobster meat, breadcrumbs, parsley, salt, black pepper, egg, and Parmesan cheese. Place a spoonful of the lobster mixture in the center of each wonton wrapper. Brush the edges of the wrapper with water and fold in half to form a triangle. Press the edges to seal. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the ravioli and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until tender and floating. Drain the ravioli and set aside. In a separate skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add the crushed tomatoes, heavy cream, and red pepper flakes. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5-6 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Serve the lobster ravioli with the tomato cream sauce spooned over the top.

Heat a large skillet over high heat. Pat the scallops dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Add the olive oil to the skillet and swirl to coat. Add the scallops to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. In a separate bowl, combine the grapefruit segments, orange segments, avocado, red onion, cilantro, and lime juice. Toss to combine. Serve the seared scallops with the citrus salad on the side.

bio: Maria Rodriguez is a self-taught chef with a passion for fusion cuisine. She draws inspiration from her Mexican heritage and the flavors of the Pacific Northwest, where she currently resides. Maria's dishes are a blend of classic techniques and modern ingredients, and she is known for her creative use of spices and seasonings.

ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, finely chopped
recipes.cooking_method: In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, olive oil, chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, salt, black pepper, chipotle pepper, and lime juice. Toss to coat. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through and pink. Warm the corn tortillas in a separate skillet over medium heat. Assemble the tacos by placing a few shrimp on each tortilla, followed by some shredded cabbage, crumbled queso fresco, and chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, gochujang, honey, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper. Add the chicken wings to the bowl and toss to coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and cold water. Heat a large pot of oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 350째F. Dip each chicken wing in the batter, shaking off any excess, and carefully drop it into the hot oil. Fry the wings for 5-6 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Drain the wings on a paper towel-lined plate. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before serving.

In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, olive oil, chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, salt, black pepper, chipotle pepper, and lime juice. Toss to coat. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through and pink. Warm the corn tortillas in a separate skillet over medium heat. Assemble the tacos by placing a few shrimp on each tortilla, followed by some shredded cabbage, crumbled queso fresco, and chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.
